FxtDocumentDescription.dataLabel: XLingPaper, as a single example, align words
FxtDocumentDescription.p: Export the interlinear text as an example containing a sequence of listInterlinear elements to a basic XLingPaper document which can then be used to cut and paste into another XLingPaper document (e.g. the XLingPaper form of the Grammar Sketch).

The interlinear concatenates all the morphemes in a word together, so there are not separate morpheme columns within a word. This corresponds with the Leipzig glossing rules (see http://www.eva.mpg.de/lingua/resources/glossing-rules.php). Further, each "sentence" of the interlinear is put under a single listInterlinear example. This is useful when creating custom texts for a grammar write-up.

XLingPaper is a way to write linguistic papers using XML technologies. Some of us like using the freely available XMLmind XML Editor with the XLingPaper configuration files for XMLmind to do this editing. See http://software.sil.org/xlingpaper.
